Name: AuthenticationAdministrator

The system shall display the login form for data entry (user name and password).
The 'administrator enters the data and submits the authentication request.
The system receives the form, verifies the data, and allows the administrator access to the system with the permissions specified.
Precondition: The 'administrator was given access to the system.
Postcondition: The system allows administrator access.
In case the administrator enters incorrect login and/or password, the system calls the use case DataErrati.
In the case where the service is not available the use case ServiceNotAvailable is invoked.
Quality Requirements: The username string is present in the system, is well-formed contains characters [a..zA..Z0..9 .-_]andhalength less than 30 characters and is not empty.
The password string is present in the system, is well-formed contains characters [a..zA..Z0..9.-_ * +!?,:; àèéìòù ] and has a length between 8 and 15characters.

Name: ActivitiesUseful
Basic flow: By selecting this use case, the Citizen accesses a screen for choosing two use cases: Woods, Waste.
The system provides a simple and intuitive screen that allows the user to choose which of the two services to visit, to indirectly help maintain acceptable, municipal environmental conditions.
The Citizen chooses one of two use cases Woods, or Waste.
The system responds to the Citizen's need by displaying the desired page he or she had requested.
Precondition: The Citizen authenticated in the municipal system.
The Citizen accessed the system.
Postcondition: The Citizen has correctly viewed the introductory screen and decides to access one of the proposed screens by calling up the Woods use case, or the Waste use case.
The Citizen is unable to view the introductory page to the two use cases, Forests, Waste and therefore extends the ServiceNotAvailable use case that handles technical failure cases.
Quality Requirements: System response times are found to be on the order of hundredths of a second if the Citizen correctly views the choice page on which use case to project.
Response times are slowed due to external problems and range in the order of seconds, from 3 to 7.

Name: BandiECompetitions
Basic flow: The Citizen accesses the initial screen in order to view the possibility of viewing the associations that support the Civil Defense.

The system responds to the need by allowing the Citizen to view all the associations under Civil Defense that employ staff, with a small image of the association, with next to it the possibility of receiving a download of the notice made available by the association in question.

The Citizen takes note of what the card provides, and chooses from which, among the associations made available, to receive news for possible recruitment or participation in the competition, about the modalities of the same.
The system responds to this need by allowing it to display the corresponding competition notice.
Precondition: The Citizen authenticated in the municipal system.
The Citizen accessed the municipal system.
Postcondition: The Citizen has completed downloading the notice that is uniquely associated with the association for which it has chosen to participate.
The Citizen is unable to view the introductory screen with all associations and therefore, the ServiceNotAvailable use case that handles technical failure cases will be extended.
Quality Requirements: The Citizen is able to view the page correctly, which means that the system's response time is in the hundredths of a second range.
The Citizen fails to display the introductory screen correctly and therefore the system would take seconds to respond, ranging from a minimum of 3 to a maximum of 7.

Name: Woods
Basic flow: The Citizen accesses this screen to be able to learn about the advice that Civil Defense makes available to anyone in order to avoid and have people avoid forest fires.

The system provides a screen with a set of rules that the Citizen should follow and have followed if he or she is with third parties, to prevent the occurrence of arson, and in case of this, which authority to call.
Precondition: The Citizen is authenticated within the municipal system.
The Citizen accessed the municipal system.
Postcondition: The Citizen is satisfied with the information and advice received.
The Citizen is unable to view the descriptive screen, so the use case ServiceNotAvailable that handles technical failure cases is extended.
Quality Requirements: The system takes time in the range of hundredths of a second for the requestor to display the screen.
Instead, the system would take time in the range of 3-5 seconds if the screen is not displayed correctly.

Name: WhatTempoFa
Basic flow: The Citizen accesses this screen to view the weather situation in the municipality where he or she resides.

The system responds to the Citizen's need by allowing him to view, in addition to the weather situation, of his municipality,also that of the provinces of the region to which he belongs, with update date, minimum and maximum temperatures, and of course, weather conditions expressed with a small descriptive image.
Precondition: The Citizen is authenticated in the municipal system.
The Citizen accessed the municipal system.
Postcondition: The Citizen is satisfied with the information received.
The Citizen is unable to view the municipality's weather page, therefore, the ServiceNotAvailable use case that handles exceptional cases of technical failure is extended.
Quality Requirements: The system responds in a time varying in the range of hundredths of a second if the user correctly displays the weather conditions screen.
The time, on the other hand, varies in the order of seconds, from a minimum of 2 to a maximum of 6, at the time when the user Citizen, is unable to know the municipal weather conditions.

Name: HowToBecomeAVolunteer
Basic flow: The Citizen accesses this descriptive screen.
The system meets the need by allowing them to know how to become a Civil Defense volunteer, and of the requirements that the Citizen will necessarily have to meet.
The Citizen acknowledges what is written and therefore wishes to access the associated form, and therefore, the DownloadModule use case will be called.
Precondition: The Citizen is authenticated within the municipal system.
The Citizen accessed the municipal system.
Postcondition: The Citizen satisfied with what he viewed from the description page and therefore invokes the use case DownloadModule.
The Citizen is unable to view the requested in-depth page, while the system extends the ServiceNotAvailable use case that handles technical failure cases.
Quality Requirements: System response times are to be found in a range in the hundredths-of-a-second unit if the Citizen displays the in-depth form correctly.
Response time increases when the Citizen does not use the in-depth service, whose time varies from a minimum of 3 to a maximum of 6 seconds.

Name: Committee
Basic flow: The Citizen accesses this service in order to take note of the hierarchical composition of the Civil Defense.

The system responds to the Citizen's curiosity with a screen where there is an organizational chart of the components of the Municipal Civil Defense in accordance with the other governmental institutions in the area according to the law of the Municipal Council approved by all.
Precondition: The Citizen is authenticated within the municipal system.
The Citizen accessed the municipal system.
Postcondition: The Citizen becomes acquainted with the components of the municipal body.
If it fails to display the page, it extends the use case, ServiceNotAvailable that handles technical failure cases.
Quality Requirements: Response times to Citizen's curiosity are in the hundredths of a second range if the screen describing the use case Committee , is displayed correctly.
If the screen cannot be provided, the system will respond in times ranging in the range of 3-8 seconds.

Name: DownloadSubscription
Basic flow: The Citizen accesses this screen because he or she wants to register for Civil Service.
The system responds with a page where the requesting Citizen can download the form to fill out and submit to the Civil Defense office.
Precondition: The Citizen has authenticated in the system.
The Citizen accessed the municipal system.
Postcondition: The Citizen has completed downloading the form, which he or she must complete and deliver in person as it requires accompanying external forms, and the use case ServizioCivile is invoked.
The Citizen is unable to view the download of the form, and therefore the ServiceNotAvailable use case is extended, which handles cases of technical failure.
Quality Requirements: The system response time to load the module download ranges from 2 to 4 seconds.
The system response time varies from 5 to 7 seconds if the module download fails.

Name: DownloadModule

Response times increase, on the order of seconds, if the Citizen does not correctly display what he or she has requested.

Name: CalculateAmount
Basic flow: The Citizen presses the button related to the tax calculation function.
The System presents the list of fees and taxes for which the amount can be calculated.
The Citizen selects the tax of interest.
The System displays a form to be completed For calculation.
The Citizen enters the necessary data.
The System verifies the correctness of the data,computes the amount and shows it to the Citizen.
Precondition: The Citizen must be connected to the system.
Postcondition: The Citizen receives the information of interest.
In case there is an error in data entry or the amount cannot be calculated, the System calls the use case CalculateImportUnsuccessful.
In case there are errors in the data entered by the citizen, the system calls the use case DataErrati.
In case there are generic errors, the system calls the use case ServiceNotAvailable.
Quality Requirements: None

Name: CalculateUnsuccessful Amount
Basic flow: The Citizen presses the button related to the tax calculation function.
The System presents the list of fees and taxes for which the amount can be calculated.
The Citizen selects the tax of interest.
The System displays a form to be completed For calculation.
The Citizen enters the necessary data.
The System verifies the correctness of the data but fails to perform the calculation, notifying the user of the reason for failure.
Precondition: This use case extends CalculateImport and is invoked when the Citizen enters incorrect data.
an error has occurred in calculating the amount.
Postcondition: The System notifies the error and resubmits the form to the Citizen.
Quality Requirements: Not provided.

Name: ContestaMulta
Basic flow: The Citizen clicks on the button to access the online fine management feature.
The System redirects the citizen to the desired section.
The Citizen clicks on the online fine payment button.
The System searches for fines against the Citizen in the database for which payment has not yet been received.
The Citizen selects the fine for which they wish to make a challenge.
The System shows all available information related to the fine, as well as the form to be filled out for dispute.
The Citizen enters the necessary information.
The System verifies the correctness of the information, forwards the dispute request to the appropriate party, and notifies the Citizen.
Precondition: The Citizen has authenticated in the system.
Postcondition: This use case extends PaymentMulte and is invoked when the citizen clicks on the button related to fine dispute.
In case there are generic errors, the system calls the use case ServiceNotAvailable.
Quality Requirements: Not provided

Name: ICI
Basic flow: II Citizen clicks on the button to access the Online Tax Payment area.
The System displays the list of fees that can be paid online.
The Citizen selects the section on Municipal Property Tax and its payment.
The System redirects the Citizen to the necessary section, showing the form of the relevant fee and the relevant amount to be paid.
The Citizen confirms that the information is correct and initiates the transaction, selecting the preferred payment method.
The System performs the transaction and displays a successful payment message.
Precondition: The Citizen has authenticated in the system.
Postcondition: The payment has been made.
In the case where there is insufficient funds to cover the payment or an error occurs in the transaction the System calls the case use case PaymentNotFailed.
In the case of other generic System-related errors, the use case is invoked ServiceNotAvailable.
Quality Requirements: Not provided.

The Citizen confirms that the information is correct, selects the preferred payment method, and initiates the transaction.
The System performs the transaction and displays a successful payment message.
Precondition: The Citizen logged in.
The Citizen has made the request for the specific service.
The service request was accepted.
Postcondition: The payment has been made.
In the case where there is insufficient funds to cover the payment or an error occurs in the transaction the System calls the case use case PaymentNotFailed.
In case there are general errors, the system calls the use case ServiceNotAvailable.
Quality Requirements: Not provided.

Name: PaymentFees
Basic flow: The Citizen clicks on the button to access the online fine management feature.
The System redirects the citizen to the desired section.
The Citizen clicks on the online fine payment button.
The System searches for fines against the Citizen in the database for which payment has not yet been received.
The Citizen selects the fine for which they wish to make payment.
The System shows the fine form and the amount to be paid.
The Citizen verifies that the information is correct and initiates the transaction, selecting the preferred payment method.
The System performs the transaction and displays a successful payment message.

In case where there is an error in data entry or there is insufficient funds to cover the payment the System calls the use case PaymentNotFailed.
The Citizen clicks on the relevant button to the dispute of a given fine,in which case the System calls the use case ContestaMulta.
In case there are errors in the data entered by the citizen, the system calls the use case DataErrati.
In case there are generic errors, the system calls the use case ServiceNotAvailable.
Quality Requirements: None
